frame.name: Commerce_sell
frame.definition:
<def-root>These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller. The words vary individually in the patterns of frame element realization they allow. For example, the typical patterns for SELL: SELLER sells GOODS to BUYER for MONEY.
<ex><fex name="Seller">Robin</fex> <t>sold</t> <fex name="Goods">a car</fex> <fex name="Buyer">to Abby</fex> <fex name="Money">for $5,000</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Buyer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>Lee <t>sold</t> a textbook <fex name="Buyer">to Abby</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction. <ex>Kim <t>sold</t> <fex name="Goods">the sweater</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> by which a commercial transaction occurs. <ex>Abby <t>sold</t> the car <fex name="Means">for cash</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Money</fen> is the thing given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction. <ex>Sam <t>sold</t> the car <fex name="Money">for $12,000</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex> The farmers' market <t>sells</t> apples <fex name="Rate">for one dollar a pound</fex> </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Seller
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>. <ex>So far, <fex name="Seller">my company</fex> has <t>sold</t> more than three million copies.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP. <ex>Bob <t>sells</t> peppers <fex name="Unit">by the pound</fex>. </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the selling event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Seller</fen> that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex>Stuart <fex name="Manner">reluctantly</fex> <t>sold</t> her his last rock.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Seller</fen> after the sale has occurred. <ex>I <t>sold</t> the whole lot <fex name="Result">at a loss</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the commerce event began to be repeated to when it stopped. <ex>I have been <t>selling</t> materials to the factories <fex name="Back">for over 5 years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Imposed_purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Buyer</fen>'s intended purpose for the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>He <t>sold</t> the filing robot to me <fex name="Imposed_purpose">for filing all my legal documents</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Back
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates that the selling act reverses an earlier separate act in which the current <fen>Seller</fen> bought the <fen>Goods</fen> from the current <fen>Buyer</fen>.
<ex> There is a plan for Mercer to buy the ground and <t>sell</t> it <fex name="Back">back</fex> to the club for more money.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Relay
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates that the selling act constitues a re-selling by the current <fen>Seller</fen> of <fen>Goods</fen> that they bought earlier from a third person who is not the <fen>Buyer</fen> of the current selling act.
<ex>The Chambers villa has been <t>sold</t> <fex name="Relay">on</fex> to a local construction company</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: sell.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: hand over in exchange for money.

lexUnit.name: vend.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: offer (small items) for sale, especially from a slot machine.

lexUnit.name: vendor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person or company offering something for sale, especially a trader in the street.

lexUnit.name: sale.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the exchange of a commodity for money; the process of selling something.

lexUnit.name: auction.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of selling goods to the highest bidder

lexUnit.name: seller.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person or company who trades an object for money
